uired":false,"description":""},"round":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":""},"square":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":""},"fullWidth":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":""},"color":{"type":{"name":"enum","value":[{"value":"'default'","computed":false},{"value":"'primary'","computed":false},{"value":"'important'","computed":false},{"value":"'transparent'","computed":false},{"value":"'shaded'","computed":false}]},"required":false,"description":""},"size":{"type":{"name":"enum","value":[{"value":"'small'","computed":false},{"value":"'medium'","computed":false},{"value":"'large'","computed":false}]},"required":false,"description":""},"align":{"type":{"name":"enum","value":[{"value":"'left'","computed":false},{"value":"'right'","computed":false},{"value":"'center'","computed":false}]},"required":false,"description":""}}}]},{"key":"src/ButtonCore/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"ButtonCore","methods":[],"props":{"as":{"type":{"name":"elementType"},"required":false,"description":"Change the rendered underlying component.","defaultValue":{"value":"'button'","computed":false}},"type":{"type":{"name":"string"},"required":false,"description":"When as === "button", this defaults to "button" so you don't have to
remember to set it yourself (as inconveniently, buttons default to
type "submit")"},"isActive":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"On links, this adds the className `is-active` to the rendered element when true.
Useful so you can use this class as the only styling hook in combination with
react-router's `NavLink` and its `activeClassName` prop.
On buttons, this turns the button into a toggle button and adds the
aria-pressed attribute to the element.
Note: This is different from react-router 5's isActive prop.
This conflict should be resolved at some point but would be a breaking change."},"isDisabled":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"When present, this adds the className `is-disabled` to the rendered element, and
the attribute `aria-disabled` when the element is a button.

This is useful so you can use this class as the only styling hook without having to rely
on the `disabled` or `aria-disabled` attributes which are only available on button elements.

Why are we using `aria-disabled="true"` instead of `disabled`?
To screen reader users, disabled buttons are completely unperceivable, while those with the
aria attribute will still be announced and labelled as disabled."},"disabled":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"An alias for the `isDisabled` prop, for alignment with the native html attribute."}}}]},{"key":"src/CenterContent/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"CenterContent","methods":[],"actualName":"CenterContent","props":{"contentWidth":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"number"},{"name":"string"},{"name":"array"}]},"required":false,"description":"Define the maximum width for the centred content.

When using this, make sure the container has a position other than static

that could lead to longer content being cut off."},"height":{"type":{"name":"number"},"required":false,"description":"Define a minimum height for the component to take up."},"spacing":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"string"},{"name":"number"},{"name":"array"}]},"required":false,"description":"Define the inner spacing between the centred content and its container.

Use the `excludedElement` prop to ignore clicks on that element.","displayName":"DocumentClickListener","methods":[],"actualName":"DocumentClickListener","props":{"onClick":{"type":{"name":"func"},"required":true,"description":""},"excludedElementRef":{"type":{"name":"object"},"required":false,"description":"Ignore clicks on the element passed here."}}}]},{"key":"src/Duration/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Duration","methods":[],"actualName":"Duration","props":{"as":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"string"},{"name":"elementType"}]},"required":false,"description":"Change the element rendered by the component","defaultValue":{"value":"'span'","computed":false}},"children":{"type":{"name":"func"},"required":false,"description":"Render function to customise the duration readout.
Is passed an object with the fields hours, minutes, seconds,
fullHours, and fullMinutes","defaultValue":{"value":"function getDefaultChildren(duration) {
	const {hours, minutes, seconds} = duration;

	const durationFragments = hours
		? [hours, zeroPad(minutes), zeroPad(seconds)]
		: [minutes, zeroPad(seconds)];

	return durationFragments.join(':');
}","computed":false}},"getLabel":{"type":{"name":"func"},"required":false,"description":"Customise the accessible label, i.e. for localisation","defaultValue":{"value":"function getDefaultLabel(minutes, hours) {
	const readableMins = `${minutes} minute${addPluralS(minutes)}`;
	if (hours) {
		return `${hours} hour${addPluralS(hours)}, ${readableMins}`;
	} else return readableMins;
}","computed":false}},"value":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"number"},{"name":"string"}]},"required":false,"description":"Duration in seconds","defaultValue":{"value":"0","computed":false}}}}]},{"key":"src/Flex/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Flex","methods":[],"actualName":"Flex","props":{"align":{"type":{"name":"enum","value":[{"value":"'top'","computed":false},{"value":"'left'","computed":false},{"value":"'center'","computed":false},{"value":"'bottom'","computed":false},{"value":"'right'","computed":false},{"value":"'stretch'","computed":false}]},"required":false,"description":"Align children on the cross axis","defaultValue":{"value":"'center'","computed":false}},"column":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"Arrange children in a column instead of a row."},"wrap":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"Allow children to take up more than one row"}}}]},{"key":"src/Icon/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Icon","methods":[],"actualName":"","props":{"color":{"type":{"name":"string"},"required":false,"description":"Display the icon in any valid CSS color. The width is not applied when the fullscreen prop is active."}}}]},{"key":"src/PopOver/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"PopOver","methods":[],"actualName":"PopOver","props":{"arrowSize":{"type":{"name":"number"},"required":false,"description":"Control the popover's arrow size","defaultValue":{"value":"12","computed":false}},"children":{"type":{"name":"func"},"required":true,"description":"Child function, providing a ref that needs to be passed to the wrapped reference component"},"content":{"type":{"name":"node"},"required":false,"description":"Set the content of the popover"},"distance":{"type":{"name":"number"},"required":false,"description":"Control the popover's distance from its reference element","defaultValue":{"value":"0","computed":false}},"isOpen":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"Control whether the popover is shown or not"},"offset":{"type":{"name":"number"},"required":false,"description":"Shift the popover along the corss-axix","defaultValue":{"value":"0","computed":false}},"placement":{"type":{"name":"enum","computed":true,"value":"placements"},"required":false,"description":"One of 'top', 'bottom', 'left', or 'right'. Add an optional suffix '-start' or '-end' to align the popover to the start or end of the chosen direction.","defaultValue":{"value":"'top'","computed":false}},"popOverRef":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"object"},{"name":"func"}]},"required":false,"description":"Access the popover's element"},"positionFixed":{"type":{"name":"bool"},"required":false,"description":"Control whether the popover should be positioned using "position: absolute" or "position: fixed"","defaultValue":{"value":"true","computed":false}},"referenceRef":{"type":{"name":"union","value":[{"name":"object"},{"name":"func"}]},"required":false,"description":"Access the reference component's element"},"renderer":{"type":{"name":"elementType"},"required":false,"description":"Customise popover rendering (e.g. for custom styling, transitions, etc).
Should be a React component that takes the props
`popOverRef`, `isOpen`, `style`, `content`, `arrow`, `resizeWatcher`,
and `refMeasurements`","defaultValue":{"value":"function DefaultPopover({
	popOverRef,
	isOpen,
	style,
	content,
	arrow,
	resizeWatcher,
}) {
	if (!isOpen) return null;

	return (
		<Portal>
			<span
				ref={popOverRef}
				style={{
					background: 'black',
					color: 'white',
					borderRadius: '3px',
					padding: '5px 10px',
					maxWidth: '100%',
					...style,
				}}
			>
				{content}
				{arrow}
				{resizeWatcher}
			</span>
		</Portal>
	);
}","computed":false}}}}]},{"key":"src/Portal/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Portal","methods":[],"actualName":"Portal","props":{"targetElement":{"type":{"name":"object"},"required":false,"description":"Element to render the Portal's children into.

the Portal's functionality"}}}]},{"key":"src/Switch/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Switch","methods":[]}]},{"key":"src/Table/Column.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Column","methods":[],"actualName":"Column","props":{"cellRenderer":{"type":{"name":"func"},"required":false,"description":"Render function for table cells. 	return (

				</Text>

		</>
